paragraphs.text:
%md
Juju KPI Dashboard
===================

This dashboard makes available data from the Juju long lived instances data.

When is data updated?
---------------------
Data is updated every few days when new logs are available for parsing and adding to the data set. 

How canI use this data?
-------------------------
It's best if you create your own notebook and use that to play with the data available. You need to prefix your "paragraph" with `%psql` in order for it to parse correctly. 

What data is there available
----------------------------



models - given a hit from a model, what verison of juju, cloud, and region is it on.
    
    CREATE TABLE models (
        uuid text PRIMARY KEY,
        version text,
        cloud text,
        region text);


model_hits - given a model what day did we see the request from that model

    CREATE TABLE model_hits (
        uuid text,
        day text,
        PRIMARY KEY (uuid, day));

   
loaded_logs  - which log files have been processed so we don't dupe process logfiles.

    CREATE TABLE loaded_logs (
        logfile text,
        started boolean,
        finished boolean,
        PRIMARY KEY (logfile));

    


Example Query
-------------
Feel free to use the default Juju KPI dashboard to view sample queries. Here's a sample one setup that grabs the 5 latest model uuids seen.

result.msg:
Juju KPI Dashboard

This dashboard makes available data from the Juju long lived instances data.

When is data updated?

Data is updated every few days when new logs are available for parsing and adding to the data set.

How canI use this data?

It's best if you create your own notebook and use that to play with the data available. You need to prefix your “paragraph” with %psql in order for it to parse correctly.

What data is there available

models - given a hit from a model, what verison of juju, cloud, and region is it on.

CREATE TABLE models (
    uuid text PRIMARY KEY,
    version text,
    cloud text,
    region text);

model_hits - given a model what day did we see the request from that model

CREATE TABLE model_hits (
    uuid text,
    day text,
    PRIMARY KEY (uuid, day));

loaded_logs - which log files have been processed so we don't dupe process logfiles.

CREATE TABLE loaded_logs (
    logfile text,
    started boolean,
    finished boolean,
    PRIMARY KEY (logfile));

Example Query

Feel free to use the default Juju KPI dashboard to view sample queries. Here's a sample one setup that grabs the 5 latest model uuids seen.

paragraphs.text:
%psql 
SELECT models.uuid, day
FROM models INNER JOIN model_hits 
    ON models.uuid = model_hits.uuid
ORDER BY model_hits.day DESC 
LIMIT 10;
